nodes.bodyText: Should we add it to @throws? Also I'd reformulate "This shouldn't happen" as it may happen, it's just a client that can't create clusters.
This is a package private class which is only used privately by the provisioner. This is just a simple check to fail early in test in case someone wrote a buggy code within this package.
This is more like an assert that shouldn't be declared as part of the API contract.
Do we need to pass network explicitly? since it's a member variable and should already be available in isInternalIpOnly right?

This change is intentional since the field can be null. So instead of checking for null everywhere, we only check it once in the createCluster method so that these methods calls would never receive null for network.
Similarly here no need to pass network explicitly to the method.
